title: My Grandma's Shoofly Pie
description: This classic Pennsylvania Dutch shoofly pie is a rich, molasses-filled treat with a crumbly brown sugar topping that has been cherished for generations. Perfect for Easter brunch or any cozy gathering, its deep, caramel-like sweetness paired with a flaky pie crust will captivate your taste buds and warm your heart.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, combine molasses, hot water, and baking soda; whisk in the beaten egg until well combined.
Pour the molasses mixture into the deep dish pie crust.
In a separate medium bowl, combine flour and brown sugar; cut in shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumb topping evenly over the pie filling.
Place the pie on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool to room temperature before serving.
tips: For a lighter flavor, substitute half of the molasses with dark corn syrup. Shoofly pie is best served at room temperature or slightly warmed with a dollop of whipped cream. Make it 1-2 days ahead to let the flavors meld — it tastes even better the next day. Use a baking sheet under the pie to catch any drips and ensure even baking.

structured_content.content: This shoofly pie is a nostalgic journey into Pennsylvania Dutch heritage, where the deep, rich molasses filling contrasts beautifully with the crumbly, buttery topping. Its warm, caramel aroma fills the kitchen, inviting everyone to gather around and share a slice of tradition that feels like a comforting hug.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for Easter brunch, holiday gatherings, or cozy family dinners
  • Uses simple pantry staples you likely have on hand
  • A timeless dessert that improves in flavor when made ahead

structured_content.content: This pie reminds me of sitting at Grandma's kitchen table, the smell of molasses and brown sugar filling the air as she told stories of her childhood. Every bite carries a piece of family history and love that makes this dessert truly special.

• Main ingredient: Molasses provides the signature deep, bittersweet flavor essential to shoofly pie; ensure it’s unsulphured for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Baking soda reacts with the molasses mixture to lighten the filling’s texture; use fresh baking soda for proper rise.
  • Supporting ingredients: Brown sugar and shortening create the crumb topping, adding sweetness and a tender, buttery crunch.
  • Equipment needed: A 9-inch deep dish pie pan, mixing bowls, whisk, and a baking sheet to catch drips during baking.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Whisk together molasses, hot water, and baking soda, then beat in the egg until smooth. Pour this filling into the prepared pie crust.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Mix flour and brown sugar, then cut in shortening until crumbly. Sprinkle this topping evenly over the filling. Bake the pie on a baking sheet for 15 minutes at 400°F, then reduce heat to 350°F (175°C) and continue baking for 30 minutes until the filling is set and the topping is golden.
Finishing Touches:
Let the pie cool completely to room temperature to allow the filling to firm up. Serve as is or slightly warmed with whipped cream for an extra indulgence.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Bake first at high heat to set the filling, then lower temperature to finish baking for a perfect texture.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling and crumb topping.
  • Look for a firm but slightly jiggly center as a doneness indicator.
  • Store covered at room temperature for 1-2 days; reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with family always brings back warm memories of holidays past and creates new ones. Its comforting sweetness is a reminder of love and tradition that transcends generations.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg to the crumb topping for a warm spice note. For a richer texture, substitute half the shortening with cold butter. A splash of vanilla extract in the filling can add depth and complexity.

Serve shoofly pie with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair it with a hot cup of coffee or spiced tea for a delightful brunch or dessert experience. It also pairs well with fresh fruit salads or light green salads for a balanced meal.

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free pie crust and substitute the all-purpose flour in the topping with almond flour or a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can be made by using flax eggs and plant-based shortening. Try adding chopped nuts to the crumb topping for extra crunch and flavor.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use unsulphured molasses for a cleaner, richer flavor.
  • Cut the shortening into the flour and sugar until coarse crumbs form to ensure a tender topping.
  • Start baking at a higher temperature to set the filling quickly, then reduce heat to avoid overcooking.
  • Garnish with a light dusting of powdered sugar or a sprig of fresh mint for an elegant presentation.

structured_content.content: With this shoofly pie recipe, you’re not just baking a dessert—you’re creating a delicious tradition that brings joy and comfort to every table. Enjoy the process and savor every bite of this timeless classic.
